history.narrative: Law 10-4, the “Confirmation Temporary Amendment Act of 1993,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-172. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 2, 1993, and April 7, 1993, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on April 30, 1993, it was assigned Act No. 10-22 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-4 became effective on June 24, 1993.
